main event: A red blinking light, the size of a pea, was sighted visually and on radar.
interesting points: The object was detected on radar by the 933rd ACGW at 2350.4.
The object was observed to make a detour around an iceberg, moving south.
The object was initially detected on radar and then gradually became visible to ground observers.
Observers used binoculars to observe the object.
The ATC comment suggests the sighting was an unexplained anomaly, possibly related to a plasma discharge or electrical disturbance, but no clear explanation could be determined.
sighted object: red blinking light, size of a pea
